name: Seated Chest Press
instruction: Keep back and head against the pad, chest up, shoulders down. Handles at armpit level. Exhale to push forward, elbows slightly bent at the top; inhale to return slowly.

name: Plank
instruction: Support on elbows under shoulders. Tighten core and glutes to keep body in a straight line. Avoid sagging hips or piking up.

name: Crunches
instruction: Lie on back, feet flat. Exhale to curl upper back off the floor using abs, keeping lower back pressed down. Pause at top, inhale to lower.

name: Barbell Squat
instruction: Feet shoulder-width apart. Bar on traps. Inhale, brace core, hinge hips and bend knees to squat. Knees aligned with toes. Exhale to stand up.

name: Jogging
instruction: Keep torso upright. Maintain steady stride and breathing rhythm. Keep heart rate in the aerobic zone.

name: Elliptical
instruction: Keep feet flat, knees slightly bent. Engage core, minimize swaying. Use both arms and legs, focusing on glutes and hamstrings.

name: Hanging Leg Raise
instruction: Hang from bar. Exhale to tuck pelvis and lift legs (bent or straight) towards chest. Inhale to lower slowly without swinging.

name: Dead Bug
instruction: Lie on back, lower back pressed to floor. Legs up at 90 degrees. Extend one leg straight out without touching floor while keeping the other still.

name: Lat Pulldown
instruction: Wide overhand grip. Depress shoulder blades first, then pull bar to upper chest, elbows pointing down. Inhale to return with control.

name: Seated Cable Row
instruction: Feet braced, back straight. Exhale to pull handle to navel, retracting shoulder blades. Keep elbows close. Inhale to return, avoid rounding back.

name: Face Pull
instruction: High pulley with rope. Pull towards face while externally rotating shoulders (thumbs back). Squeeze rear delts and rotator cuff.

name: Dumbbell Curl
instruction: Keep upper arms fixed at sides. Exhale to curl dumbbell up, squeezing biceps. Inhale to lower slowly until arm is fully extended.

name: Tricep Pushdown
instruction: Lean forward slightly, upper arms pinned to sides. Exhale to push down until arms are straight. Inhale to return to forearm parallel.

name: Romanian Deadlift
instruction: Neutral spine, soft knees. Inhale to hinge hips back, lowering bar along thighs until below knees. Feel hamstring stretch. Exhale to extend hips forward.

name: Leg Press
instruction: Back flat against pad. Feet shoulder-width. Inhale to lower weight until knees are 90 degrees. Exhale to push up, do not lock knees.

name: Seated Leg Curl
instruction: Align knee with machine pivot. Exhale to curl calves down and back. Squeeze hamstrings. Inhale to return with control.

name: Leg Extension
instruction: Align knee with machine pivot. Exhale to kick legs up until straight. Squeeze quads for 1s. Inhale to lower slowly.

name: Barbell Bench Press
instruction: Eyes under bar. Grip wider than shoulders. Inhale to lower bar to mid-chest. Exhale to press up. Keep shoulder blades retracted.

name: Dumbbell Row
instruction: Support on bench with one hand and knee. Back flat. Exhale to pull dumbbell to hip, keeping elbow close. Squeeze back. Inhale to lower.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
instruction: Core tight. Palms forward. Exhale to press dumbbells overhead until arms are straight but not locked. Inhale to lower to ear level.

name: Barbell Hip Thrust
instruction: Upper back on bench. Bar on hip crease. Tuck chin. Exhale to drive hips up until body is flat. Squeeze glutes. Inhale to lower.

name: Incline Dumbbell Press
instruction: Bench at 30-45 degrees. Exhale to press up, focusing on upper chest. Inhale to lower until elbows are slightly below shoulders.

name: Reverse Fly (Machine)
instruction: Face machine. Arms slightly bent. Exhale to open arms back using rear delts. Squeeze shoulder blades. Inhale to return.

name: Cycling
instruction: Adjust seat height so knee is slightly bent at bottom. Keep upper body stable. Maintain steady cadence and adjust resistance.

name: V-Sit
instruction: Balance on sit bones. Lift legs and lean back to form a V shape. Arms forward. Keep core very tight and back straight.
